pullRequest.title: Layout and Code Refactoring for Questions and Answers
pullRequest.bodyText:
Checklist

 I tested all changes and all related features with different users (student, tutor, instructor, admin) on the test server https://artemistest.ase.in.tum.de.
 Client: I added multiple integration tests (Jest) related to the features
 Client: I added authorities to all new routes and check the course groups for displaying navigation elements (links, buttons)
 Client: I documented the TypeScript code using JSDoc style.
 Client: I added multiple screenshots/screencasts of my UI changes
 Client: I translated all the newly inserted strings into German and English

Motivation and Context


Code is hard to read with a lot of duplication.
Questions and Answers are too small for longer texts.
Description

Refactored the code to include less methods and to be more readable.
Extracted the question-answer and question component.
Changed the design of the UI.
Added the functionality to collapse the questions and answers.
Added the functionality to resize the questions and answers by dragging.
Adapted the layout on smaller screens: Questions and Answers are shown below the detail information
Steps for Testing


Log in to Artemis
(1a. If not already, enable questions and answers for the course)
Navigate to an exercise or a lecture detail page
Play around with questions and answers (especially with the new drag and collapse feature)

Screenshots


New design of Question and Answers:




Collapsed Questions and Answers:

commit.message: remove leftover from merge-conflict from previous PR
remove unnecessary code and fix for different screen sizes
fix breakpoint for larger exercise descriptions

nodes.bodyText: Instead of [ngClass] = ... you could use [class.answer-approved]="studentQuestionAnswer.tutorApproved" which is cleaner ImO, but feel free to keep your code if you like it better
I think angular events do not bubble like normal javascript dom events -> event.stopPropagagtion is not needed
